1.text: Lords, render ye to servants Justice and equality; knowing that ye also have a Lord in the heavens.

2.text: In prayer persevere, watching in it in gratitude.

3.text: Praying together also for us, that God would open to us a door of the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, by which also I was bound;

4.text: That I might manifest, as is fitting for me to speak.

5.text: In wisdom walk toward them without, purchasing the time.

6.text: Your word always in grace, Seasoned with salt, to know how it is fitting for you to answer one another.

7.text: All things concerning me shall Tychicus make known to you, a dearly beloved brother, and a faithful servant and fellowservant in the Lord:

8.text: Whom I sent to you for this same, that he might know the things concerning you, and comfort your hearts;

9.text: With Onesimus, the faithful and dearly beloved brother, who is of you. They shall make known to you all the thing here.

10.text: Aristarchus my fellowcaptive greets you, and Marcus, sisterâ€™s son to Barnabas, (for whom ye received commands: if he come to you, receive him;)

11.text: And Jesus, called Justus, they being of the circumcision. These only fellow workers in the kingdom of God, which were a consolation to me.

12.text: Epaphras, who of you, greets you, a servant of Christ, always contending for you in prayers, that ye may stand perfected and completed in all the will of God.

13.text: For I bear testimony to him, that he has much zeal for you, and for them in Laodicea, and for them in Hierapolis.

14.text: Luke, the dearly beloved physician, greets you, and Demas.

15.text: Greet the brethren in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church in his house.

16.text: And when the epistle shall be read among you, make that also it be read to the church in Laodicea; and that ye also read that from Laodicea.

17.text: And say to Archippus, Look out for the service which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fill it.

18.text: The greeting of Paul by my hand. Remember my bonds. Grace with you. Amen.
